articles.content:

articles.title: HIV diagnoses in Australia lowest since 1980s, but COVID-19 a likely driver - Medical Xpress
articles.description: Across Australia, there were 633 new diagnoses of HIV in 2020, a decline of 30 percent since 2019, according to new data released today on World AIDS Day by the Kirby Institute at UNSW Sydney.
